para.text: Lock-out consists of shutting down the power source to the machine or devices and locking it.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-65px; margin-top:11px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:11px; margin-left:91px; line-height:1.18; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:714px right ;
para.text: Example: Set the main power switch to the "OFF" position and secure it using a padlock or
a lockout device such as a cover.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Tag-out consists of placing a warning tag to prevent anyone from turning ON the power supply.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:-65px; margin-top:11px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:91px; line-height:1.18; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Example: Place a "Do Not Operate" or "Under Maintenance" sign with the operator's name and department and indicating that machine operation is prohibited on the main power switch and main operation panel.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:8px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Lock-out/tag-out should be performed to prevent inadvertent operation and ensure operator safety.

list.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:-11px; margin-top:11px; margin-right:68px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:41px; line-height:1.18; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:47px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:-11px; margin-top:11px; margin-right:68px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:41px; line-height:1.18; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:47px left ;
li.text: Performing lock-out/tag-out alone does not completely ensure operator safety. The operator must read and thoroughly understand the work procedures and safety precautions, and always be aware of potential hazards.

para.text: Each operator should perform lock-out or tag-out by himself or herself. Perform this procedure before starting the work, and release the lock and remove warning tag yourself after finishing work. Never release a lock and remove a sign without confirming with the operator or without the presence of the operator himself or herself.

li.text: Be sure to clearly define and implement the lock-out and tag-out procedures of your company.
